snippet: President Obama said he would pursue a “diplomatic path” on the Syria crisis even while making the moral case for punishing the country for its deadly use of chemical weapons.
abstract: Pres Obama says he will hold off on military action against Syria and pursue Russian proposal for international monitors to seize and destroy Syria's chemical weapons; even in the face of widespread opposition, Obama makes impassioned case for retaliatory strike, saying in starkly emotional terms that Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad’s use of chemical weapons could not be tolerated.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and JONATHAN WEISMAN
byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said he would pursue a “diplomatic path” on the Syria crisis even while making the moral case for punishing the country for its deadly use of chemical weapons.

headline.main: Obama Delays Syria Strike to Focus on a Russian Plan
headline.print_headline: Obama Delays Syria Strike To Focus on a Russian Plan
